attributes.action: Request from the UK Government to allow asylum seekers to stay ,remain in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Because we are a group of asylum seekers who want to contribute and be next to the British people there are many precessions among us could be useful in this crisis like nurses doctors drivers cooks and etc. and we would love to contribute the Uk gave us safety security and peace and we appreciate it . so we respectfully ask the government to cancel all the deportation cases because with this situation any deportation process can be a life threatening  threat 
We appreciate you in advance .
attributes.background: We ask the UK government to stop deportation of asylum seekers from the UK in this critical situation , as we are in this corona virus crisis now ,we are asking government to cancel all the deportations and let us stay , any deportation can be a life threatening threat for any asylum seeker .

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Help Asylum Seekers in UK during the Covid-19 Outbreak: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311322

Stop All UK Deportation Activity during this Corona Virus Pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310313

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
